A little difficult to find (even for my cab driver), but once you'll do, you'll be happy you didn't give up.  - Very friendly service.  Even with the server's limited English and my non-existent Spanish, we figured out what we wanted to eat- The maians salad was incredible.  One of the best things I've eaten.  It really was a white fish crudo with some kind of thick and savory sauce and anchovies on it.  Very, very good- The albondigas meatballs in a clam broth were also delicious.  They were milder than I expected, but the different flavors complemented one another well- Our paella mixto was almost perfect.  Nice and moist.  It was the best flavored paella we've had here.  The only way to improve the dish would be to have a little bit of a crust- The creme brulee was not very good- The miamimisu dessert was cool, creamy, and full of sugary deliciousness.  The best dessert we've hadOverall, we really enjoyed our meal.  One word of warning.  Although Yelp says they take credit cards.  They do not.  Fortunately, there is an ATM around the corner and the server was very apologetic for the mix-up.
